plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: The common sunflower is a tall annual plant known for its large, bright yellow flower heads that track the sun across the sky. It thrives in temperate climates and is widely cultivated for its seeds and oil.
plants.funFact: Sunflowers exhibit heliotropism when young, turning their heads to follow the sun's path across the sky.

plants.name: Dahlia pinnata
plants.description: Dahlias are tuberous plants native to Mexico, known for their diverse and vibrant flower forms and colors. They bloom from mid-summer through the first frost and are popular garden plants globally.
plants.funFact: There are over 42 species of dahlias, and they are related to sunflowers and asters.

plants.name: Erythrina crista-galli
plants.description: A perennial tree native to South America, particularly Argentina and Uruguay, with striking bright red flowers shaped like a rooster's crest. It blooms profusely in late summer to early autumn.
plants.funFact: The national flower of Argentina and Uruguay, known locally as 'Ceibo.'

plants.name: Wisteria sinensis
plants.description: A woody climbing vine famous for its cascading clusters of fragrant purple to pale violet flowers. Although usually blooming in spring, certain late-season cultivars may bloom again in early autumn in mild climates.
plants.bloomingSeason: Spring primarily; sporadic bloom in early autumn
plants.location: China, cultivated in temperate regions worldwide
plants.funFact: Wisteria vines can live over 100 years and produce very heavy, fragrant blooms.
